cyclone.name: SALLY
cyclone.current_location: about 65 miles E of the Mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: slowly turning north-northeast and then northeast toward the north-central Gulf Coast (southeast Louisiana, Mississippi, Alabama, western Florida Panhandle)
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: north-central Gulf Coast near the MS/AL border (Biloxi–Mobile area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch/Warning area stretches east of the Mouth of the Pearl River to Navarre FL; Tropical-storm warning extends east of Navarre to Indian Pass FL and westward to Grand Isle LA
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane warning east of the Pearl River to Navarre FL; Storm-surge warning Mouth of Mississippi River to Okaloosa/Walton County Line FL
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from southeast Louisiana to the western Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.wind: Only a very small (≤4%) chance of tropical-storm-force gusts; routine breezy conditions otherwise
weather_observation.rainfall: No significant rainfall directly associated with Sally expected at Port Everglades
weather_observation.other_hazards: Long-period swells could marginally increase rip-current risk along southeast Florida beaches, but port operations should remain normal
